[Interactive visualisation of the connectome graph](Full_connectome_modules_with_names.html){.external target="_blank"} of the three-day-old *Platynereis dumerilii* larva, containing all cells in the whole-body connectome. Nodes represent individual neurons or effector cells. Directed edges (arrows) represent synaptic connections from the presynaptic neuron to the postsynaptic cell. Nodes are coloured by connectome module.
<br>


[Interactive visualisation of the cell-type-level connectome graph](Figure4_celltype_network.html){.external target="_blank"} of the three-day-old *Platynereis dumerilii* larva. Nodes represent cell types (cells grouped into one node by cell type).
<br>

[Interactive visualisation of the cell-type-level connectome graph](network_with_transmitters.html){.external target="_blank"}, same graph as before, but the nodes are coloured by transmitter phenotype.
<br>

[Interactive visualisation of the cell-type-level connectome graph](network_with_IO_layout.html){.external target="_blank"}, same graph as before, but the nodes are arranged based on the ratio of incoming to outgoing synapses.
